clinical_study.brief_title: GOLD 0 - DLCO 1: A Look Beyond the Obstruction. Is Spirometry Enough for COPD (Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease) Screening?
clinical_study.official_title: GOLD 0 - DLCO 1: A Look Beyond the Obstruction. Is Spirometry Enough for COPD Screening?

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundación para la Investigación del Hospital Clínico de Valencia

clinical_study.source: Fundación para la Investigación del Hospital Clínico de Valencia

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a multicenter observational prospective study in smokers or ex-smokers with cumulative exposure ≥ 10 a / p (years / pack) with respiratory symptoms and presenting a normal spirometry.
The patients who sign the corresponding informed consent, will undergo a DLCO and will be divided into two groups according to the result:
- Group I. Patients with DLCO <80%.
- Group II Patients with DLCO≥80%.
Both groups will be followed for 5 years.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline of Diffusion Capacity (DLCO) at 5 years
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 years
primary_outcome.description: To determine the value of DLCO in COPD screening in smokers and ex-smokers with respiratory symptoms and normal spirometry (GOLD 0)

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk factors associated to the development of COPD
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: Risk factors associated to the development of COPD

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline of inflammatory Markers at 2 and 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: To Study soluble receptors involved in inflammation processes and tissue repair in early disease stages.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: To Study of oxidative stress parameters in early disease stages

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: To Characterize patients in stage 0 of GOLD with impaired diffusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline of High Resolution Computed Tomography (HRTC) at 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: To determine changes in HRCT to identify subgroups of patients with different clinical and evolutionary trajectories

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: To Investigate the contribution of measuring lung volumes for the diagnosis of COPD when there is no evidence of airflow limitation in spirometry (GOLD 0).

secondary_outcome.measure: Gender differences in value of diffusion (DLCO)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: To assess if there are differences between men and women with diffusion disorder

To assess whether factors, such as the effect of lung development during childhood and adolescence, bronchial hyperreactivity and / or the role of infections influences the risk of developing the disease or its progression.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: To characterize the comorbidities associated with GOLD 0 patients and altered diffusion.

arm_group.description: Patients with DLCO <80% will be followed at baseline and once a year during the study
Patients with DLCO ≥80% only will be followed at baseline and year 5.

intervention.description: Patients will followed during 5 years, and only 2 visits , baseline and 5 years

intervention.intervention_name: Standard Care plus oxidative stress study plus inflammation biomarkers study
intervention.description: Patients will followed during 5 years, Annual follo-up visits will be carried out during this period

study_pop.textblock: Subjects over 18 smokers or ex-smokers with cumulative exposure ≥ 10 a / p (years /pack) with respiratory symptoms presenting normal spirometry

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥18 years. The participant or his / her legal representative is willing and able to give informed consent to participate in the study.
- Female or male patients with age equal to or greater than 18 years.
- Smokers or ex-smokers with cumulative exposure ≥ 10 a / p
- Respiratory symptoms
- Normal spirometry.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age under 18 years.
- Participation in another clinical study.
- Patients with a life expectancy of less than 2 years due to neoplasms or other serious systemic diseases.
- Refusal to sing informed consent.
